channel.title: The Hodljuice Daily Pint
channel.itunes:author: Various
channel.description: Daily collection of various Bitcoin-related podcasts

item.title: Bitcoin_Audible : Guy's Take_091 - The Path of Greatest Pain
item.itunes:author: Bitcoin_Audible
item.itunes:keywords: Personal growth, Bitcoin market volatility, perseverance
item.description: This episode explores the parallels between life's struggles and Bitcoin's market fluctuations, highlighting the importance of enduring challenges for eventual success. It reflects on Robert Frost's quote about choices and their significance over time.

item.title: Bitcoin_Optech : Bitcoin Optech: Newsletter #319 Recap
item.itunes:author: Bitcoin_Optech
item.itunes:keywords: Bitcoin technical updates, market analysis, development
item.description: The hosts recap key developments from Newsletter #319, discussing topics such as the Stratum v2 extension, recent releases in Bitcoin software, and notable changes in Bitcoin Core. The episode provides insights into ongoing improvements and vulnerabilities in the protocol.

item.title: Bitcoin_Veterans : 059. Aleksandar Svetski
item.itunes:author: Bitcoin_Veterans
item.itunes:keywords: Bitcoin innovation, cryptocurrency entrepreneurship, community building
item.description: In this episode, Aleksandar Svetski discusses his work in launching various Bitcoin-focused initiatives, including a Bitcoin-only savings app and open-sourcing educational materials. The conversation covers the evolution of the Bitcoin landscape and the importance of community engagement.

item.title: Bitcoin_Veterans : Bitcoin Veterans SITREP: Bitcoin and Politics - How Economic Systems Shape Our Future
item.itunes:author: Bitcoin_Veterans
item.itunes:keywords: Immigration, economic systems, political engagement
item.description: This episode explores the implications of immigration on local economies and the upcoming political debates, emphasizing community involvement and preparedness for governance. The hosts discuss how economic stability is influenced by government control and community actions.

item.title: Bitcoin_and_Markets : Can Bitcoin turn it around right here, right now in Uptember? Bitcoin Dawn, Weekly Roundup - E395
item.itunes:author: Bitcoin_and_Markets
item.itunes:keywords: Market analysis, macroeconomic trends, investment strategies
item.description: This episode discusses Bitcoin's current state, analyzing recent macroeconomic trends and their implications on the cryptocurrency market. The hosts evaluate key indicators to predict Bitcoin's potential recovery this month.

item.title: Blockware : Lessons Learned Holding Bitcoin Since 2014
item.itunes:author: Blockware
item.itunes:keywords: Long-term investment, market experience, Bitcoin community
item.description: The episode features insights from holding Bitcoin since 2014, discussing market trends, the importance of free speech, and experiences within the Bitcoin community. Listeners gain a perspective on the long-term benefits and personal anecdotes from the speaker’s journey.

item.title: Flirting_With_Bitcoin : ⚡🌆 FWB100 - Nostr City, Bitcoin Island
item.itunes:author: Flirting_With_Bitcoin
item.itunes:keywords: Decentralization, community building, Bitcoin transactions
item.description: In this episode, the hosts delve into the concept of Nostr City and how it relates to Bitcoin Island, discussing decentralized communication and economic innovation. The significance of Bitcoin in fostering community and local economies is emphasized throughout the conversation.

item.title: Onramp_Media : The New Frontier E004: Bitcoin and Islam with Bitcoin Majlis
item.itunes:author: Onramp_Media
item.itunes:keywords: Islamic finance, ethical investing, community education
item.description: Abdullah and Salah discuss Bitcoin's relevance within Islamic finance, examining its alignment with anti-riba principles and the mission of Bitcoin Majlis to educate the Muslim community. The episode highlights Bitcoin’s potential to offer a more ethical financial alternative.

item.title: Pleb_UnderGround : Post Mortem: Friend.tech Just Failed!
item.itunes:author: Pleb_UnderGround
item.itunes:keywords: Cryptocurrency failures, market analysis, emotional responses
item.description: This episode analyzes the recent failure of friend.tech, examining the reasons behind its downfall and the financial implications for its creators. The hosts provide insights into the current emotional landscape in the cryptocurrency market.

item.title: Robin_Seyer : Roman Reher: MAJOR BTC Supercycle has already STARTED!
item.itunes:author: Robin_Seyer
item.itunes:keywords: Bitcoin supercycle, institutional adoption, self-custody
item.description: Robin Seyr and Roman Reher discuss Bitcoin's potential within a long-term supercycle, the implications of ETFs, and the importance of individual self-custody in a future Bitcoinized world. The episode highlights significant shifts in investment perceptions and the need for open-source solutions.

item.title: Simply_Bitcoin : Jack Mallers Debates Peter Schiff on Bitcoin | EP 1072
item.itunes:author: Simply_Bitcoin
item.itunes:keywords: Bitcoin value proposition, financial debate, economic perspectives
item.description: Jack Mallers engages in a debate with Peter Schiff, discussing Bitcoin's role as a hedge against inflation and addressing traditional finance criticisms. Their contrasting views provide insight into the ongoing discourse about Bitcoin’s future in the financial ecosystem.

item.title: Stephan Livera Podcast : Bitcoin Product Market Fit For Savings with Pierre Rochard SLP602
item.itunes:author: Stephan Livera Podcast
item.itunes:keywords: Long-term saving strategies, Bitcoin standard, cultural impacts
item.description: Stephan Livera and Pierre Rochard discuss Bitcoin's product-market fit for long-term savings, introducing a metric based on UTXO age. The conversation emphasizes aligning financial decisions with personal goals and the societal implications of adopting a Bitcoin standard.

item.title: TFTC_A_Bitcoin_Podcast : #535: The State of Bitcoin-Backed Credit with Matt Dines
item.itunes:author: TFTC_A_Bitcoin_Podcast
item.itunes:keywords: Bitcoin-backed credit, market predictions, financial strategies
item.description: Matt Dines discusses the Bitcoin-backed credit market, comparing it to various financial instruments and predicting future trends. The episode provides in-depth insights into the evolving landscape of credit in relation to Bitcoin and its financial implications.

item.title: The_Bitcoin_Frontier : Is 2025 the year bitcoin accelerates? with Joe Consorti
item.itunes:author: The_Bitcoin_Frontier
item.itunes:keywords: Economic outlook, Bitcoin growth trajectory, market analysis
item.description: Joe Consorti discusses the implications of fiscal deficits on Bitcoin's future, exploring liquidity and rate cut impacts while examining growth models like power law and stock-to-flow. He presents insights on the potential evolution of Bitcoin amid economic changes up to 2025.

item.title: The_Bitcoin_Layer : Why Overturning Chevron Matters for Bitcoin and Civil Liberties
item.itunes:author: The_Bitcoin_Layer
item.itunes:keywords: Regulation, civil liberties, Bitcoin industry
item.description: The episode features a discussion about the significance of overturning the Chevron Doctrine and its implications for the Bitcoin industry, focusing on regulatory power and civil liberties. Insights are provided on recent victories in restoring freedoms and the role of administrative agencies.

item.title: The_Breakdown : The Story in the Latest Bitcoin Price Action
item.itunes:author: The_Breakdown
item.itunes:keywords: Crypto market trends, investment strategy, market sentiment
item.description: NLW analyzes recent Bitcoin price action and its implications for market sentiment, discussing trends and historical patterns that may guide investor decisions. The episode aims to provide listeners with clarity on the current state of the cryptocurrency market.

item.title: The_Canadian_Bitcoiners_Podcast : The CBP #180 (Other Notable News Stories) - More Elections, American Debates, Bitcoin Price Action
item.itunes:author: The_Canadian_Bitcoiners_Podcast
item.itunes:keywords: Political analysis, Canadian perspective, Bitcoin developments
item.description: This episode covers various news stories related to Bitcoin, including updates on elections and American political debates, alongside analysis of current Bitcoin price trends from a Canadian viewpoint. The hosts provide engaging discussions while reinforcing the importance of understanding Bitcoin's implications.

item.title: The_What_is_Money_Show : Web5: The Future of the Bitcoin-Based Internet with Polycarp Nakamoto (WiM512)
item.itunes:author: The_What_is_Money_Show
item.itunes:keywords: Decentralized applications, internet architecture, Bitcoin's role
item.description: Polycarp Nakamoto discusses the evolution of the web and Bitcoin's foundational role in promoting decentralized applications. The episode emphasizes the need for user control over data and software in the future of the internet.

item.title: Bitcoin_Veterans: Bitcoin Veterans SITREP: Navigating Bitcoin's Volatility - Lessons from MicroStrategy's Journey
item.itunes:author: Bitcoin_Veterans
item.itunes:keywords: [Bitcoin Volatility, Investment Strategies, Community Engagement]
item.description: The hosts discuss recent developments in Bitcoin, featuring an interview with Michael Saylor who shares insights on Bitcoin as a digital asset and its performance in comparison to traditional investments. They cover topics including political impacts on Bitcoin and community efforts in adoption.

item.title: Bitcoin_for_Millennials: University Professor: “The Money System is Taking Advantage of You” | BFM080
item.itunes:author: Bitcoin_for_Millennials
item.itunes:keywords: [Bitcoin Education, Government Intervention, Financial System Trust]
item.description: Business Professor Sina discusses his insights on Bitcoin's resilience against government intervention and emphasizes the need for education regarding Bitcoin and finance. He addresses the challenges posed by the current financial system and positions Bitcoin as a solution to inflation.

item.title: Coin Stories with Natalie Brunell: Bitcoin Mechanic: Is Bitcoin Too Centralized? Mining Pools & Freedom Money vs State Surveilled SoV
item.itunes:author: Coin Stories with Natalie Brunell
item.itunes:keywords: [Bitcoin Centralization, Censorship, Mining Mechanics]
item.description: In this episode, the Bitcoin Mechanic discusses centralization concerns in Bitcoin, censorship risks, and the workings of mining pools. The implications of a surveillance state on Bitcoin are also explored, emphasizing its role as 'freedom money.'

item.title: Fractal_Bitcoin: Bitcoin waiting for October? ETF 8-day record streak of outflows, who is selling?? - Ep.185
item.itunes:author: Fractal_Bitcoin
item.itunes:keywords: [Bitcoin Market Trends, Price Predictions, ETF Impact]
item.description: The podcast presents a price update detailing Bitcoin's current value and predictions for the coming months, particularly October. It discusses record outflows in the Bitcoin market and reflects on past Halving years, correlating them with current trends.

item.title: Life_with_Bitcoin: Think Big & Start Small w/ Hero of Bitcoin, Creator of the Hero of Bitcoin Game
item.itunes:author: Life_with_Bitcoin
item.itunes:keywords: [Bitcoin Culture, Gaming, Community Support]
item.description: This episode features the creator of the "Hero of Bitcoin" game, which immerses players in Bitcoin culture through a narrative set in El Salvador. Discussions highlight community creativity and grassroots support for Bitcoin adoption.

item.title: Live_From_Bitcoin_Beach: #Bitcoin Circular Economies - Bitcoin Beach Grants Winners | Bitcoin Sranan
item.itunes:author: Live_From_Bitcoin_Beach
item.itunes:keywords: [Circular Economies, Bitcoin Beach Initiative, Community Projects]
item.description: This episode highlights the winners of the Bitcoin Circular Economies Grants, focusing on meaningful projects like @BitcoinSranan in Suriname. Insights into the impact of Bitcoin Beach initiatives are shared.

item.title: Money Matters with Jack Mallers: EP.35: Bitcoin & Dollar Liquidity: Who's Really in Control?
item.itunes:author: Money Matters with Jack Mallers
item.itunes:keywords: [Financial Markets, Dollar Liquidity, Bitcoin Debate]
item.description: Bill Mallers Jr. joins to analyze Bitcoin’s recent price movements and its connection to broader financial trends, discussing macroeconomic shifts and insights from a debate on Bitcoin vs. Gold.

item.title: Onramp_Media: Wake Up Call (9.9.24): Wyatt O'Rourke, Founder of Basilic Financial
item.itunes:author: Onramp_Media
item.itunes:keywords: [Bitcoin Investment Thesis, Financial Education, Legacy Financial Services]
item.description: This weekly show seeks to educate financial professionals about Bitcoin as an investment, highlighting its challenges and opportunities for differentiation from traditional financial services. The hosts interview guests to share their Bitcoin journeys.

item.title: Simply_Bitcoin: Michael Saylor Predicts $13M Bitcoin on National TV | EP 1071
item.itunes:author: Simply_Bitcoin
item.itunes:keywords: [Bitcoin Predictions, Market Dynamics, Adoption]
item.description: Michael Saylor boldly predicts Bitcoin could reach $13 million during a televised discussion, addressing the implications for investors and the cryptocurrency market. The episode underscores Bitcoin's transformative role in the global economy.

item.title: The_Bitcoin_Standard_Podcast: 238. Legal Foundations of a Free Society with Stephan Kinsella
item.itunes:author: The_Bitcoin_Standard_Podcast
item.itunes:keywords: [Libertarianism, Property Rights, Societal Freedom]
item.description: Legal Scholar Stephan Kinsella discusses his book on libertarianism and property rights vital for a free society, critiquing the concept of intellectual property. The discourse encourages reflection on how property rights uphold individual freedoms.

item.title: The_Block_Reward__Bitcoin_For_Beginners: 50: What is Bitcoin?
item.itunes:author: The_Block_Reward__Bitcoin_For_Beginners
item.itunes:keywords: [Bitcoin Overview, Monetary Policy, Crypto Security]
item.description: In this milestone episode, Scott reflects on Bitcoin's unique features, monetary implications, and security mechanisms like proof of work. He emphasizes the historical context of Bitcoin in contrast to traditional currency systems.

item.title: The_Bugle_Weekly: Comedy Fundamentals With Fundamentals | Bugle Weekly Episode 25
item.itunes:author: The_Bugle_Weekly
item.itunes:keywords: [Bitcoin News, Cryptocurrency Trends, Comedic Commentary]
item.description: This episode covers significant Bitcoin news and notable developments in the cryptocurrency space, blending humor with insightful discussions on the current landscape. The hosts provide a comprehensive overview of recent events.

item.title: The_Canadian_Bitcoiners_Podcast: The CBP #180 (Bitcoin News Stories) - Canadian Elections, American Debates, Bitcoin Price Action
item.itunes:author: The_Canadian_Bitcoiners_Podcast
item.itunes:keywords: [Political Influence on Bitcoin, Price Analysis, Canadian Developments]
item.description: The hosts analyze current Bitcoin news related to Canadian elections and American debates, discussing their implications on the cryptocurrency market and how Bitcoin might affect Canada’s economy.

item.title: The_Mining_Pod: Blockstream’s ASIC Mining Note With Adam Back
item.itunes:author: The_Mining_Pod
item.itunes:keywords: [Bitcoin Mining, Financial Instruments, Energy Consumption]
item.description: Adam Back, CEO of Blockstream, discusses the company’s mining operations and introduces a new financial instrument, the Mining Note, designed to allow individuals to invest in Bitcoin mining. The conversation includes insights on energy usage and investment strategies.

item.title: The_Progressive_Bitcoiner: TPB104 – Nostr: Promoting Freedom and Healing Brokenness with Will Casarin and Roger Huang
item.itunes:author: The_Progressive_Bitcoiner
item.itunes:keywords: [Nostr, Digital Freedom, Decentralized Communication]
item.description: Will Casarin discusses Nostr’s significance as a decentralized platform promoting freedom and addressing challenges in digital communications. He likens Nostr’s importance to that of Bitcoin in fostering social healing.
